body.name: TECLAST Tablet 12 inch Android 13 Tablets, T60 with 256GB Storage(Expand to 1TB), Unisoc T616 CPU, 8000mAh +18W PD Fast Charger, 4 Speakers, 5G WiFi+4G LTE, Dual 13MP Camera,GPS
features: 【Android 13 tablet, 256GB ROM】2024 new large-capacity Android 13 tablet 12 inch T60 has 16GB RAM (8GB RAM + 8GB extend), 256GB ROM allows you to store more photos and documents. A micro SD card slot expands storage up to 1TB (FAT32 format, sold separately) so you can store all your favorite media files together, including ebooks, videos, photos. The 12 inch T60 tablet with Android 13 and GMS certified, allowing you to download popular apps from the Google Play Store. Additionally, Android 13 operating system and allows you to add a QR code scanner to your lock screen, improving your privacy and security. You can also upgrade your personalization options

【2K IPS 12 inch Display + Widevine L1】Teclast T60 tablet with a 12 inch 2K display, providing a realistic visual experience with clear details. Using IPS Incell fully laminated display technology, the screen is clearer, richer in color, and also provides a wider viewing angle. Effectively filters harmful blue light, reduces eye fatigue and irritation, and protects your vision health. Additionally, T60 tablet supports Widevine L1. This allows you to smoothly watch copyrighted content such as high-quality HD content and streaming services on Prime video, DISNEP, Hulu, etc. It also supports wireless projection and can easily connect to a large TV

【T616 8-core tablet + 8000mAh + 18W PD fast charging】UNISOC T616 It has faster reading and writing capabilities than MT8183, Maintains excellent performance while suppressing heat generation. Android13 tablet T60 can provide the ultimate mobile gaming experience. Its Mali-G57 multi-core GPU making mobile games more visually stunning. The 8000mAh large-capacity battery allows you to enjoy movies, TV series, music, etc. for a long time with confidence. Battery life has never been better! The 12 inch tablet T60 also supports 18W USB-PD fast charging to reduce charging time. (Note: 18W adapter sold separately.）

【Dual 4G LTE +AC Wifi+ Dual camera】 Dual SIM/Micro SD slot, supports TD-LTE and FDD-LTE 4G, you can freely work and live on the network Switch to support simultaneous calls and network VoLTE. Network Frequency : GSM:B2,B3,B5,B8; WCDMA:B1,B2,B5,B8; FDD-LTE:B1,B3,B5,B7,B8,B20; TD-LTE:B34,B38,B39,B40,B41. Stay connected and entertained with high-speed AC dual-band 2.4Ghz/5Ghz Wi-Fi and efficient BT 5.0 wireless connectivity. The rear camera uses a 13MP stacked camera to capture precious moments in life even in low light. The 5MP front camera can provide clearer images for selfies and video calls.

【Multi-functional and thin 12 inch tablet】Teclast T60 tablet is equipped with 4 sound chambers to bring you a better external listening experience. It also has GPS functionality and you can use Google Maps by downloading offline maps to your tablet. The T60 is 7.7mm thick and adopts a portable all-metal design. It weighs 570 grams, making it easy to carry with you to work, study or on the go.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Brilliant images / Speedy task switching 2024 NEW large-screen 12 Inch tablet TECLAST T60! ! ! TECLAST T60 is 12 inch (2000x1200) display and 4 speakers, allowing you to enjoy immersive sound and images anywhere. You can enjoy images comfortably by adjusting the ambient light according to the surrounding brightness.Equipped with an 8-core processor for fast and responsive gameplay. Dual-band Wi-Fi support provides high-speed connections and low latency, making it easy to download large amounts of data.Enjoy your time in comfort with the Tablet T60, designed to suit a variety of lifestyles

8 Core CPU - Unrivaled Speed - Beyond Fast Gaming Powered by the Unisoc T606 octa-core Processor Teclast T60 boasts two high-performance A75 cores running at 1.6GHz, paired with six power-efficient A55 cores. This blend ensures optimal performance for both work and multimedia, providing a seamless, energy-conscious tablet experience. Equipped with Mali-G57 Graphics Processor Teclast T60 delivers cooler special effects and a smoother gaming experience. It is also capable of supporting cutting-edge applications like AR (Augmented Reality) and VR (Virtual Reality).

Storage More --- Power for all day Store Steady, Expand Ready *Note: 16GB refers to 8GB LPDDR4X memory and an up to 8GB virtual memory expansion. From Dawn to Dusk, Stay Powered. Encased in a slender 7.8mm frame, the Teclast T60 boasts an 8000mAh polymer lithium battery, delivering up to 10 hours* of continuous use. Paired with 18W PD fast charging, you're powered up swiftly, wherever you are.
Max Screen for Study Face Recognition Wireless Screencasting

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I use this (Teclast T60) as a mobile gym of sorts, participating in online streaming fitness classes, and usually outdoors.Everything works like it's supposed to, even when multitasking, with no buggy surprises. The launcher overlay dock and navigation bar are always present at the bottom of the screen. Since the screen size has so much room, it enhances the navigation experience. At the operating system, everything looks legit, with basically no bloatware. The device hardware (memory, CPU, GPU, etc.) matches what is advertised.This is unlike a tablet that I had purchased (and returned) from a different vendor a few weeks prior to this. That tablet's Android version was "borrowed" from another Android device using different hardware, and was a glitchy mess that misadvertised core count, misadvertised the GPU, and who knows what other surprises. This was not the case at all with this Teclast tablet.I haven't run any synthetic benchmarks, but more importantly, I was able to video stream a Zoom call the other day, while tethered to a 4G phone, in a windy outdoor park for an hour in low light. Not a single hang up or glitch during the call, with bluetooth connected to earbuds, and a keyboard, and occasionally using other apps at the same time. And that was a day or two after receiving the tablet, and on the original charge. The call consumed perhaps 10-15% of the battery. This convinced me the tablet was a keeper!Pros:- Battery life good- Screen brightness is good enough- The quad speakers sound better than I expected- Comes with screen protector installed- Bright red Lenovo-style main side key button is easy to spot in low light- Costs around half the price of similar sized/specced tablets of well-known brandsCons:- This 12" tablet is a non-mainstream size, so less accessories to choose from at the moment- Was not aware that it comes with a screen protector installed (had to cancel the one I ordered)Unknown:- Game/3D graphics performance- SIM card functionality- Photo and video quality (good enough for me and gets the job done)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Can't Change Chinese Day
reviews.reviewText: When I received this tablet, the day, time and date were set to Chinese time. I set up my Google account and the Calendar reflected the correct day and date. I could correct the time to US Eastern Standard. But the screen display kept showing the Chinese day and date -- one day ahead of the US day and date.I am returning the tablet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It’s only give 2g for mobile data.
reviews.reviewText: The tablet appearance look really good. The quality is awesome. The big problem I had with it is that the tablet only work with Wi-Fi but when using with mobile data the internet became really terrible. I bought this for work and my work require me to have good internet at all time. If you want to use this tablet only at with Wi-Fi then you should buy this tablet. But if you want to use it with mobile data please do not buy it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A great tablet, and "oh-so close" to perfect from TecLast
reviews.reviewText: I normally buy Apple, but wanted a cheap "throw around" tablet and decided to try Android/Teclast a while back. 3 tablets later I still keep buying these Teclast tablets - maybe I have a problem. I gift my old ones away and people love them. I have had the M40 Pro, T40S, and now the T60.If you want the larger screen, this is probably their best one yet. I was about to order this model and import it, as I have been looking for it in the states for a while, then it (finally) arrived on Amazon. It was a few dollars more on Amazon, but you have easy returns and 2 day shipping. Still worth the price after the promotional coupon.Construction - 9/10. Really clean design - nice edges, slim design, feels solid, and lightweight. Lock button is textured and red which is nice being so close to volume buttons. USB-C charge port is on the bottom now. Back just has a cheap sticker for the model information, but that can be removed easily.Audio - 8/10. Probably the best audio yet in a Teclast tablet, you can actually use this at low volumes - previous models even on low volumes were quite loud. If you do crank it up, it gets pretty loud with decent bass for speakers this small. Nice it has four speakers, two on both sides.Display - 8/10. It's a really crisp large screen, but I dinged it a couple points because of a couple minor issues. 1) It's not very bright, if you plan to use this outdoors much you might have issues - it's fine inside. 2) Streaming (YouTube, etc.) the color tones just seem "off" to me, especially with skin tones. It's hard to describe, I thought initially it was a contrast setting but can't seem to completely fix it - people look almost washed out in videos. You don't really see it otherwise, and the effect is more noticeable depending on the amount of light in the scene. It's not a deal breaker, just odd, and I wonder if it's a result of the super high-res screen. 3) I can't seem to stream from my media server reliably anything over 1080P and ~20Mbps to the device. Which is fine (1080P on a 12" screen is plenty!), but was confused at first as I couldn't get videos to play until I forced it to downgrade the quality. Will test this more.Cameras - 6/10. It's nothing spectacular, and not very good in low light. But more then enough for a video call or quick pics.OS - It's Android 13, and if you like Android should be at home. Has a few nice features and benefits over 12. Also nice Teclast doesn't install any bloat-ware, and it did get an OS update over Wifi after setup. Not being a huge fan of Android, I install a different launcher and highly customize it. I was happy to see Nova Launch worked great on 13.Storage - It's HUGE! 8GB Memory (plus 8GB of slower expanded memory), and 256MB for your storage needs (still not sure why teclast calls it ROM memory). And if you need more storage, you can easily expand it with a micro SD card. It seems common in the Android/Tablet market to list the total memory as 16GB when it's really 8GB fast main memory + 8GB slower expansion memory. Even though it's only 8GB of fast memory I've had many things open at once with plenty of room to spare. You may need to enable the expansion memory in your settings.Performance - It's FAST! This thing is snappy, faster then any tablet I have purchased from them. I don't game much so can't comment on that, but think it should be fine with most titles. But web browsing and jumping between apps is instant response and a good experience.Battery - So far this seems reasonable, but still hope it improves after a few charge cycles. The faster CPU and large screen does come at a cost for power usage, but the big battery helps mitigate that some. AccuBattery (doesn't have much history yet) is saying 11 hours continuous, and 30 hours of time under normal "mixed" operating conditions.Cellular/SIM - Not tested, but it does support a SIM card and cellular data if you wanted to use that feature.What's in the BOX?! - Not much really. I was hoping for at least the (normally free) bundled flip case, but no luck. They did include an already applied free screen protector, so that's a win. Other then that, you get a USB-C cable and US power brick. Hopefully more accessories turn up on Amazon, as of right now if you want a case or better screen protector you'll need to import them.Sorry for the long review, hope it's helpful.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND TABLET!
reviews.reviewText: Tablet was definitely al I needed in a tablet.Customer care has definitely gone above and beyond to assisting with getting promotional products as well that I had trouble ordering .I would definitely recommend tablet and company in future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This tablet has everything you need
reviews.reviewText: This tablet is great. It has a quality look and feel. Nice crisp display. The performance is outstanding too. It is very quick and the pages load fast. The screen is bright and clear and is very responsive to the touch. Whether you need a starter tablet or more advanced, this one has you covered.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Meets my expectations
reviews.reviewText: The unit is fast and the picture quality is excellent.Just started using it. First impressions are that it has a good bright screen with good contrast, plays videos just fine and runs fast with very little lag. Very good value.
